result.title: Objective
result.description: To consolidate the operational and financial sustainability of Jamaicaâ€˜s National System of Protected Areas

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description:
Increase in NSPA operational sustainability measured by average METT score for all PAs based on the following definitions:
High (75-100), Medium (55-74), Low (<55).

baseline.comment:
High: number of PAs - 0
Medium: number of PAs - 4
Low: number of PAs - 28

target.comment:
High: number of PAs - 2
Medium: number of PAs - 6
Low: number of PAs - 24

actual.comment:
High: number of PAs - 1
Medium: number of PAs - 13
Low: number of PAs - 18

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Increase in NSPA financial capacity measured by Financial Sustainability Scorecard

baseline.comment: Financial Score (Part 2): 53

target.comment:
Financial Score (Part 2): 122
(The highest score possible is 225)

actual.comment: The revised target includes that the highest score possible is 225. The Financial Sustainability scorecard will be applied to the project's mid term evaluation.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Area of Closed Broad-leaf Forest within NPAS sustained

baseline.comment: Broad-leaf: 88,000 hectares

target.comment: No change in area of Closed Broad-leaf Forest: 88,000 hectares

actual.comment: The most current data is unavailable, however there is data for the 2012-2013 period which reflects a decrease of approximately 4,000 hectares.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Area of living reef within 10 NPAS monitoring sites sustained

baseline.comment: Area of Reef: 3% - 30% living

target.comment: No change in Area of Reef: 3% - 30% living

actual.comment: The most current data is unavailable, however there is data for the 2012-2013 period which reflects no change in the area of living reef. There was 3%- 30% living reef.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description:
Population of 4 indicator species sustained in PAs proposed to be monitored:
1. Endemic Giant Swallowtail Butterfly (Pterouus humerus)
2. Queen Conch (Strombus gigas)
3. Black Bill Parrot (Amazona agilis)
4.Yellow Bill Parrot (Amazona collaria)

baseline.comment:
Number of individuals of:
endemic Giant Swallowtail Butterfly (Pterouus humerus), endemic Jamaican BlackBird (Nesopsar niggerrimus), Hawksbill Turtle (Eretmochelys imbricate), and Queen Conch (Strombus gigas) (exact figures to be determined at project inception)

target.comment:
Distribution and Density of endemic Swallowtail Butterfly same as baseline data
No change in Queen Conch: Depth Strata (metres)
0 -10 – 243 conch/hectare
10-20 - 145 conch/hectare
20-30 – 165 conch/hectare
Biomass estimate – 12,214 metric tonne

actual.comment: Current data is unavailable, however a survey is to be done for the biomass of Queen Conch and the report should be available by early 2016.

result.title: Outcome 1
result.description: Strengthening of financial planning and revenue generation

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Increase in Protected Area Trust Fund principal and annual disbursement to NPAS

baseline.comment:
Trust Fund Principle: 0
Annual Disbursement to NPAS: 0

target.comment:
Caribbean Biodiversity Fund (CBF) Principal: US$ 3.35 million
Disbursement to NPAS: US$ 100,000 - US$ 250,000

actual.comment:
CBF Principal: US$ 3.4 million
Still awaiting transfer of US$ 750,000 from UNDP to the CBF.
Disbursement to NPAS (from CBF): $0.
Processes leading to the signing of the Vertical Agreement with the CBF are underway

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description:
Amount of funds generated locally by the Local PA Trust Fund.
% of the Trust Fund principal generated locally

actual.comment:
$0
Mechanism to capitalize Trust Fund is being developed. Tourism Enhancement Fund (TEF) Proposal being developed. Preliminary discussions have been positive.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Increase in annual government funding for PAs

actual.comment: No data collected

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Increase in annual non-government resources

actual.comment: No data collected

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: Number of PAs with business plans that reflect NPAS standards

baseline.comment: 0 PAs with business plans that reflect NPAS standards

target.comment:
8 PAs with business plans that reflect NPAS standards
(25% increase)

actual.comment: Four business plans have been completed, but require revisions based on the recommendations of the Project Steering Committee. The development of four additional business plans is underway.

indicator.title: Indicator 6
indicator.description: Local Protected Area Trust Fund 100% established and fully operational by 2016.

baseline.comment: 0 Protected Areas Trust Fund existing locally

target.comment:
Establishment of the Local Trust Fund by 2014.
Operationalization of the Local Trust Fund by 2016.

actual.comment:
Local Trust Fund was established in December 2014.
The operationalization process is underway. The National Conservation Trust Fund of Jamaica Board established and endorsed by the relevant Government Minister. Draft By-laws have been completed and will be finalized shortly.

indicator.title: Indicator 7
indicator.description: Number of Protected Areas with mechanisms to generate revenue at the site level

baseline.comment: 1 PAs with mechanisms to generate revenue (BJCMNP)

target.comment: Revenue generation in 5 PAs

actual.comment: 1 PA with mechanisms to generate revenue (BJCMNP). However, plans are underway to facilitate the development of revenue generation mechanisms in additional PAs.

indicator.title: Indicator 8
indicator.description: Extent to which operational plan for the PA system financial strategy developed.

baseline.comment: No such strategy available.

target.comment: Operational Plan for the PA system financial strategy developed.

actual.comment: The NPAS Project has procured the services of Global Parks volunteers to facilitate the development of the operational plan for the PA system financial strategy. Completion expected by December 2016.

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Status of developing drafting instructions for umbrella PA legislation and supporting legal framework.

baseline.comment: 0 Umbrella legislation for NPAS

target.comment: Drafting instructions for umbrella PA legislation and supporting legal framework developed

actual.comment: Drafting instructions partially completed (draft should be ready by September 2015). Draft policy near completion (should be ready by mid-August 2015)

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Number of new PA landscapes declared and implementing management plans that reflect integrated landscape/seascape wide approaches to combating PA threats

baseline.comment: Zero (0) new coastal and marine PA landscapes declared and implementing management plans that reflect integrated landscape/seascape wide approaches to combating PA threats

target.comment: One (1) new coastal and one (1) new marine PA landscape declared and implementing management plans that reflect integrated landscape/seascape wide approaches to combating PA threats.

actual.comment: No new PA landscapes declared and implementing management plans.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Number of PAs with clearly designated lead and support entity.

baseline.comment: One (1) PA within NSPA legal agreement designation PA management authority.

target.comment: 6 Protected Areas within the NPAS with legal agreements designating PA Management Authority.

actual.comment: Four (4) agreements are in place for the system.

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Increase in PA management effectiveness measured by METT scores

baseline.comment:
METT Scores for 28 PAs and 4 Forest Regions:
Montego Bay Marine Park - 44
Blue and John Crow Mtn National Park 72
Negril EPA - 32
Negril Marine Park 39
Palisadoes-Port Royal Protected Area 27
Coral Spring-Mountain Spring 19
Portland Bight Protected Area 36
Ocho Rios Protected Area 19
Mason River protected Area - 54
Bogue Islands Fish Sanctuary - 14
Bowden Fish Sanctuary - 13
Airport Point Fish Sanctuary - 46
Discovery Bay Fish Sanctuary - 34
Bluefields Bay Fish Sanctuary - 33
Orange Bay Fish Sanctuary - 36
Galeon Bay Fish Sanctuary - 30
Salt Harbour Fish Sanctuary - 36
Galleon Harbour Fish Sanctuary - 32
Three Bays Fish Sanctuary - 32
Forestry Northeast - 58
Forestry Southeast - 56
Forestry Northwest - 40
Forestry Southwest - 45
Port Royal and Palisadoes - 52
Black River - 21
Spanish Town - 41
Titchfield Hill - 43
Falmouth - 35
Seville - 74
Rio Nuevo - 17
Mountain River Cave - 44
Mason River Reserve - 54
(Note that there are 102 Forest Reserves found within the four (4) Forest Regions listed as individual PAs)

target.comment: 25% overall increase in METT scores for 50% of the 28 PAs and 4 Forest Regions of NPAS.

actual.comment:
METT Scores for 28 PAs and 4 Forest Regions at Mid-Project (2012-2013):
Montego Bay Marine Park - 66
Blue and John Crow Mtn National Park 75
Negril EPA - 36
Negril Marine Park 36
Palisadoes-Port Royal Protected Area 29
Coral Spring-Mountain Spring 19
Portland Bight Protected Area 50
Ocho Rios Protected Area 22
Mason River protected Area - 54
Bogue Islands Special Fishery Conservation Area - 53
Port Morant Special Fishery Conservation Area (formerly Bowden Fish Sanctuary) - 13
Montego Bay Point Special Fishery Conservation Area (formerly Airport Point Fish Sanctuary) - 50
Discovery Bay Special Fishery Conservation Area - 60
Bluefields Bay Special Fishery Conservation Area- 66
Orange Bay Special Fishery Conservation Area - 52
Galleon Bay Special Fishery Conservation Area - 49
Salt Harbour Special Fishery Conservation Area - 62
Galleon Harbour Special Fishery Conservation Area - 63
Three Bays Special Fishery Conservation Area- 61
Forestry Northeast - 62
Forestry Southeast - 58
Forestry Northwest - 43
Forestry Southwest - 49
Port Royal and Palisadoes - 67
Black River - 52
Spanish Town - 60
Titchfield Peninsula - 55
Falmouth Historic District - 57
Seville Great House - 72
Rio Nuevo - 29
Mountain River Cave - 50
Mason River Reserve - 54
(Note that there are 102 Forest Reserves found within the four (4) Forest Regions listed as individual PAs)

indicator.title: Indicator 6
indicator.description: Number of PAs that contribute to and/or access biological information through CBD Jamaica Clearing House Mechanism (JaCHM).

baseline.comment: One (1) PA contributing to and accessing the CBD JaCHM.

target.comment: 28 PAs and 4 Forest Regions contributing to the JaCHM. Accessing of database and website by end users to include PA Managers (100% of PAs)

actual.comment: Same as in June 2014. Currently the NPAS Project Management Unit is liaising with the JaCHM to ascertain the process for increasing access and/or contributions to the JaCHM on the part of Protected Areas

indicator.title: Indicator 7
indicator.description: Number of PAs with management plans that reflect NPAS management guideline standards

baseline.comment: Zero (0) PAs with management plans that reflect NPAS management guideline standards

target.comment: 8 PAs with management plans that reflect NPAS management guideline standards (25%)

actual.comment: Five (5) PAs with management plans. NPAS guidelines are near completion.

indicator.title: Indicator 8
indicator.description: Extent to which the Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) System for NPA management developed.

baseline.comment: 0 M&E system for NPA Management

target.comment: Monitoring and Evaluation sytem for protected area management developed.

actual.comment: Research is being conducted by the NPAS Biodiversity Conservation Specialist (University of the West Indies, Mona) towards the devlopment of the Monitoring and Evaluation System for Protected Area Management.

indicator.title: Indicator 9
indicator.description: Number of PAS with conservation-based economic activities

baseline.comment: 0 PAs with conservation-based economic activities

target.comment: 3 PAs with conservation-based economic activities implemented.

actual.comment: Proposals have been requested from the following protected areas: Pedro Bank, Black River, Gourie Forest Reserve, Port Royal Heritage District and Mason RIver Protected Area. A proposal was received from the Gourie Forest Reserve.

indicator.title: Indicator 10
indicator.description: Status of implementation of Communication Strategy for NPAS

target.comment: Communication Strategy for NPAS implemented in 20 key PAs

actual.comment: Communication Strategy for NPAS implemented in 7 key PAs. Plans are being finalized to implement the Communication Strategy for NPAS in PAs through various means including Public Service Announcements.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: Implementation of National Energy Policy; # of GOJ institutions implementing environmental management systems (EMS); # of financial incentive for energy efficiency; # of energy efficiency plans implemented;

baseline.comment: Jamaica’s National Energy Policy 2009 -2030 which was tabled in Parliament. Subsequently, the Ministry of Energy and Mining produced several supporting documents which provide a strong policy framework and enabling environment for ensuring energy security and efficiency in Jamaica. There is a strong demand and need to ensure policy coherence across institutions and ministries to achieve the targets outlined in the National Energy Policy which includes a reduction in the use of petroleum and an increase in renewable energy.

target.comment: Construction of the wind turbines Site assessments/selection conducted for deployment of small scale wind turbines Deployment of wind turbines at selected sites

actual.comment: Construction of the wind turbines have not yet been completed Of five site assessments for the deployment of the two wind turbines, two were selected Nazareth All Age and Rose Hill Primary, both in Mandeville The wind turbines have not been deployed. This is expected to be done in the first quarter of 2015

target.comment: Construction of the wind turbines Site assessments/selection conducted for deployment of small scale wind turbines Deployment of wind turbines at selected sites

actual.comment: This target was not met as the firm hired to complete the activities related to the targets was said to be in breach of contract. The contract was subsequently terminated and the project recommended to be closed. The activities related to these targets have been subsumed under the GEF 5 project currently being developed by the Country Office.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1.1 Montreal Protocol consumption limits and phaseout of 33Mt.

baseline.comment: 1.1 Maximum allowable consumption 00 (ODP tonnes) in Foam Sector

target.comment: 1.1 Zero importation of HCFC 141b by companies that manufacture foam products.

actual.comment: 1.1 Target achieved. There was no importation of HCFC 141b during the year. Additional funds approved to assist Seal Sprayed Solutions to maintain zero importation of HCFC 141b. NEPA signed a Memorandum of Understanding with Seal Sprayed to facilitate the re-imbursement of funds for purchasing alternatives to HCFC-141b.

target.comment: 1.1 Zero importation of HCFC 14lb from 1 January to 31 December 2015 by companies that manufacture foam products

actual.comment: 1.1 Conversion of a foam manufacturing enterprise (Seal Sprayed Solutions) from HCFC 141b based to non ODS based technology achieved. There was zero importation of HCFC 141b during the quarter 1 of 2015.

iati-activity.title: Support to Effective National Implementation
iati-activity.description: While assisting the Government in achieving its priorities and in line with the CPD (2012-2016), UNDP Jamaica is strategically supporting the achievement of inclusive and transformational outcomes within its areas of comparative advantage

iati-activity.title: Support to Effective Implem 2
iati-activity.description: Provide targeted assistance to build GOJ capacity to deliver on selected national development priorities in line with the ‘Vision 2030 Jamaica: National Development Plan.

Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1) Extent to which the National Strategy for Development Effectiveness developed (fully, partially, not developed) 2) Status of completion of National Consultative Workshops (fully, partially, not done) 3) Percentage of International Development Partners (IDP) in Jamaica consulted for validation 4) Number of International development cooperation summits Jamaica is represented 5) Percent of Implementing Partners assisted in monitoring through validation visits 6) Percentage of quarterly reports received by the CO by the requested deadlines 7) Number of IDP Project Staff trained on RBM 8) Percent of requests from GOJ for technical assistance in M&E fulfilled 9) Percentage of GOJ requests for specialised training for officials facilitated 10) % of participants submitting action plans on applying training for improvement of performance in their MDA 11) Number of initiatives to share knowledge and experience supported 12) Number of international conferences attended by govt officials 13) Number of relevant staff trained in Project Management 14) Percent of relevant entities represented at the high-level sensitization session 15) Number of project proposals developed for submission for funding that relate to government priorities 16) Number of stakeholder consultation sessions conducted that relate to government priorities 17) Number of forums organized to share knowledge and experience on resource mobilization 18) Percentage of proposals successful in securing funding

baseline.comment: 1) National Strategy for Development Effectiveness draft framework developed 2) No National Consultative Workshop for DE Strategy held 3) No International Development Partners (IDP) in Jamaica consulted for validation of Development Effectiveness Strategy 4) No representation at International development cooperation summits by Jamaica 5) No Implementing Partners assisted in monitoring through validation visits 6) 60% of quarterly reports received by the CO by the requested deadline 7) 40 IDP Project Staff trained on RBM 8) No requests from GOJ for technical assistance in M&E fulfilled 9) No GOJ requests for specialised training for officials facilitated 10) No participants submitting action plans on applying training for improvement of performance in their MDA 11) No forums share knowledge and experience held 12) No international conferences attended by govt officials 13) No relevant staff trained in Project Management 14) No entities represented at the high-level sensitization session 15) No proposals developed for submission for funding that relate to government priorities 16) No stakeholder consultation sessions conducted that relate to government priorities 17 No forums organized to share knowledge and experience on resource mobilization 18)No proposals successful in securing funding

target.comment:
Outcome 1 1. The National Strategy for Development Effectiveness completed 2. National Consultative Workshop completed 3. Minimum 80% of IDPs consulted 4. Jamaica is represented at 50% of International high level development cooperation meetings
Outcome 2 1. 100 % of Implementing Partners assisted in monitoring through validation visits 2. 80% of the quarterly report received by the CO before the deadline 3. 80 Project Staff trained on RBM 4. 80 % of requests from GOJ for technical assistance in M&E fulfilled.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: Output 1 Indicators 1. Status of the Culture Assessment Report (completed, partially completed, not done) 2. Extent to which Change Management Strategy is developed (fully, partially, not done) 3. Extent to which Communication Strategy and Plan is developed 4. Degree of completion of strategy on business processes in which Behavioural Economics applies 5. Percentage of staff trained to deliver on interventions 6. Extent to which the Framework for replication of change management strategies developed 7. Percentage of MOFP staff trained in replicating change management 8. Percentage of government agencies identified for replication

baseline.comment: Output 1 1. No culture assessment of the staff of MOFP 2. No change management and transformation strategy in place at the Ministry of Finance and Planning (MOFP) 4. No assessment of business processes in which Behavioural Economics applies No Framework for replication of change management strategies in place

target.comment: 1. Status of Culture Assessment Report: completed

iati-activity.title: Support to Bahamas Post Hurricane Joaquin
iati-activity.description: This project will allow UNDP Jamaica, which covers the Bahamas, to support the identification for short and long term priorities for Recovery and Reconstruction.

iati-activity.title: Early recovery strategy
iati-activity.description: Rapid needs assessment to be conducted, which will inform the development of a livelihoods & social sector impact assessment and/or temporary resettlement plan for most affected islands.
